title: Obesity is barely covered in medical students' licensing exam

title_detail.value: Obesity is barely covered in medical students' licensing exam

summary: Obesity is one of the most significant threats to health in the U.S. and is responsible for the development of multiple serious medical problems such as diabetes, heart disease and some forms of cancer. Yet obesity is barely covered in medical training, according to a new study. The licensing exams for graduating medical students have a surprisingly limited number of test items about obesity prevention and treatment.
